rooms.description: A spacious entrance hall with a minimalist design, incorporating Vastu principles by orienting the main entry towards the east to harness morning sunlight and positive energy. The space features exposed concrete walls, floor-to-ceiling windows on one side for natural light.

A large living area with a Brutalist aesthetic, featuring monolithic forms and raw materials. Floor-to-ceiling windows allow ample daylight while maintaining structural integrity. The room is designed to face south for maximum natural light as per Vastu guidelines.
A dining area adjacent to the living room, with a simple yet robust design. It includes floor-to-ceiling windows along one wall for brightness and an open layout that encourages family interactions.

The kitchen features exposed concrete finishes and modern appliances. Floor-to-ceiling windows provide ample natural light, while its north-west orientation adheres to Vastu principles for maintaining balance and functionality.

A well-appointed guest room that includes floor-to-ceiling windows for ventilation and light. The room is designed in a minimalist style with a focus on raw concrete finishes in line with Brutalist architecture.

A compact bathroom designed for privacy and functionality, integrating natural light through small openings. Materials are selected to complement the Brutalist style while ensuring proper ventilation as per local norms.

openings.description: The main entrance is designed with a robust frame to accommodate the heavy use typical in residential design. The eastern orientation complies with Vastu principles for inviting positive energy.
A secondary exit for safety and ventilation, located on the west side of the house.

rooms.description: A spacious master bedroom with floor-to-ceiling windows to maximize natural light, designed using raw concrete finishes and minimalist decor. The room is oriented towards the north-east as per Vastu principles for relaxation.

An additional bedroom featuring floor-to-ceiling windows and a raw, industrial look that aligns with Brutalist aesthetics. The room is positioned to receive adequate light and maintain balance in energy flow.
Another bedroom designed with similar principles as above, ensuring consistency in style while meeting the functional requirements of the space.
A compact bathroom on the first floor that incorporates elements of minimalism and functionality. The design adheres to local building norms with a focus on efficient space utilization.

openings.description: A centrally located staircase connecting the ground floor and first floor. The design incorporates robust materials in line with Brutalist style.

building_info.notes: Design incorporates Vastu principles by orienting the main entrance towards the east and master bedroom towards the north-east for optimal energy flow. Floor-to-ceiling windows are used throughout to maximize natural light while adhering to local building norms.
